SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

network
Interface Node

public interface Node

A machine on the network. May be either a router or a leaf node.

Author:
Luke Maurer
See Also:
Simulator.buildNode(int)

Method Summary
 int address()
          The address of the node, analogous to an IP address.
 List<? extends Interface> interfaces()
          Get all of this node's network interfaces.
 Kernel kernel()
          Retrieve this node's kernel.
 String name()
          A purely descriptive name.
 

Method Detail

name

String name()
A purely descriptive name. Need not be unique, much less useful; only used for display.

Returns:
A name for the node.

address

int address()
The address of the node, analogous to an IP address. In this simulation, this identifies one node, no matter how many interfaces it has, whereas of course in real life each interface has its own address.

Returns:
The node's address. Currently it's just a number, with no structure of its own, but this may change.

kernel

Kernel kernel()
Retrieve this node's kernel. See the Kernel interface for more on its role.

Returns:
The kernel specified for this node at creation time.

interfaces

List<? extends Interface> interfaces()
Get all of this node's network interfaces.

Returns:
An immutable list view of the node's interfaces.
